page.title: 15Housing in Jedburgh
page.content: The appearance of the town has improved over the last 20 years.Many old houses have been renovated.The Castlegate closes stretching back from the street have won a Saltire award from Civic Trust and Europa Nostra award.The Canongate looked derelict till new shops with interesting arches and houses above were built.There is beautiful stonework houses in the Castlegate the older part of the town. At the top of the doorways there are many date stones.Behind the High Street there is sheltered housing with a scented garden.The colours of some houses in the Market Square and Canongate are the colours of Autumn leaves.There are many large stone- built houses on the fringe of the town.Council houses are very attractive and varied in style.
